title: The Stolen Formula
introMessage:
Three nights ago, between 2:00 and 4:00 AM, someone broke into the Jorvik Advanced Research Laboratory (JARL). The lab is known for its high-tech security, but this thief got past everything—locks, cameras, alarms—without leaving a trace.

The target? A secret chemical formula, locked away in a vault deep underground. This formula isn’t just any experiment; in the wrong hands, it could be turned into a powerful weapon.

Sarah Chen, the lead scientist, discovered the break-in when she arrived at work. The vault was wide open, the formula was gone, and the security system had been carefully manipulated. But something doesn’t add up—none of the alarms went off, yet nothing seems obviously damaged. It’s almost as if the thief knew exactly how to slip through unnoticed.

She suspects someone from inside the lab helped the thief, but she has no proof. The answer lies somewhere in the details—hidden in conversations, routines, and overlooked details from that night.

Your Mission:
	•	Figure out how the thief got inside. Someone bypassed the lab’s security with incredible precision—how?
	•	Talk to the people at JARL. Scientists, security staff, and others might have seen or heard something.
	•	Follow the trail of clues. Every detail matters, and the truth is waiting to be uncovered.

characters.name: Sarah Chen
characters.description: Dr. Sarah Chen is the brilliant mind behind JARL’s most ambitious projects. With an intense yet composed demeanor, she approaches her work with meticulous precision. Her sharp eyes miss nothing, and her scientific expertise is matched only by her relentless pursuit of the truth. The theft of the secret formula was not just a professional setback—it was personal. Now, she is determined to uncover how it happened and who was behind it.
characters.portraitPrompt: Female research scientist at a chemical company. She looks very smart. She is very welcoming and friendly.

characters.name: John Thomsen
characters.description: John Thomsen is the unwavering guardian of JARL. With years of experience in high-tech security, he knows every corridor and every potential threat. When the vault was breached, it shook him to his core—someone had outmaneuvered the very defenses he had sworn to protect. Now, he is more determined than ever to catch the culprit and restore JARL’s security.
characters.portraitPrompt: Male, Works as head of Security at a chemical company.

characters.name: Elena Martínez
characters.description: Elena Martínez moves like a ghost through JARL’s dimly lit corridors. Armed with her mop and keys, she is both unnoticed and ever-watchful. Her routine has made her intimately familiar with every corner of the facility—yet, something felt different in the days leading up to the heist. She saw unusual equipment being moved through the loading dock, and now, that detail refuses to leave her mind.
characters.portraitPrompt: Female janitor at a chemical company. She looks tired.

characters.name: Mike Rodriguez
characters.description: Mike Rodriguez is a dedicated security guard who takes his job seriously—perhaps too seriously. His ironclad routine was shattered the night of the heist when he woke up in the break room, groggy and disoriented. Someone had spiked his coffee, knocking him out cold. The only thing he remembers is a vague glimpse of unmarked vans at the loading dock. The sense of betrayal gnaws at him, and now, he is desperate to make things right.
characters.portraitPrompt: Male security guard at a chemical company. He looks clumsy and distracted.

clues.description: A coffee cup found in the break room with traces of sedatives. This explains why Mike Rodriguez was unconscious during the theft, making him an unknowing victim.
The official maintenance schedule shows no planned work on the night of the theft, contradicting the presence of supposed maintenance workers seen around that time.
Elena Martínez reported seeing maintenance workers she didn’t recognize in the facility days before the theft. This raises suspicion that they might have been scouting the area.
John Thomsen confessed he collaborated with the thieves, providing them with the vault’s security protocols in exchange for money.
Footage from the night of the theft shows unmarked vans at the loading dock, possibly used by the thieves to gain entry or transport stolen materials.
The security logs from the night of the theft show no forced entry, suggesting the thieves had insider access to bypass security systems.
Unmarked maintenance vans were seen in the days leading up to the theft, but they did not match any known company vehicles, suggesting they were part of the thieves' plan.

conditionals.revealedInformation: Sarah saw John meeting with strangers in the parking lot some days before the theft, but didn't think much of it at the time since he's head of security.

conditionals.condition: asks about security material like security logs or camera footage
conditionals.revealedInformation:
John didn't see anything suspicious in the security logs.
John didn't see anything suspicious in the security camera footage, just maintenance vans.

conditionals.condition: asks about the night shift workers
conditionals.revealedInformation: Mike was found unconscious a few hours after the theft in the break room.

conditionals.condition: asks about the security camera footage or the vans
conditionals.revealedInformation: Mike will identify the vans as belonging to the maintenance company, but doesn't have the usual license plates.

conditionals.condition: asks about Mike's drink before passing out
conditionals.revealedInformation: Mike tasted something odd in his drink that night. He thought it was just a new coffee brand, but they were sedatives.
Mike will point out that no maintenance was scheduled for that night
Elena Martinez will describe seeing unfamiliar workers in maintenance uniforms during the night of the theft and reported it to John.

conditionals.condition: asks about the break room coffee
conditionals.revealedInformation: Elena Martinez will remember seeing someone unfamiliar near the break room earlier that evening.

conditionals.condition: asks about the suspicious maintenance workers, or about what Elena reported to him
conditionals.revealedInformation:
John will admit he lied.
John provided all the security information to the thieves a few days before the theft.
John is the main responsible person for the theft. He was motivated by money. 
John is going to jail. He will accept his fate
